intro: Esterhazya montana, commonly known as the mountain esterhazya, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, hollow stems and finely divided leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in compound umbels, and it blooms during the summer months. Esterhazya montana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
